text: Chinna Anuppanadi is a census town in Madurai district in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. It is famous for the birthplace of Sowmiyanarayanan & King Rama Varma (1332-1370), who is most commonly known as the Madurai Man. He brought the very first mathematical tool in the Indian subcontinent, called Nalanda, to the coastal areas in Asia. It was this town that was the center of the Nalanda University during its centuries long history. It had a golden era for its Mahabharata period, when the town has a magnificent temple dedicated to Rama's Father Brahma, which had a two storey with encircling with sculptures. ==Demographics== India census, Chinna Anuppanadi had a population of 15,415. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Chinna Anuppanadi has an average literacy rate of 70%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 77% and female literacy of 63%. 11% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==Social Worker== NEYA NARPANI MANDRAM ==References== Category:Neighbourhoods and suburbs of Madurai
title: Chinna Anuppanadi
